Moo, Compare and Contrast
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Moo, Compare and Contrast
By hengers rock on Friday, September 21, 2001 - 04:47 pm:

ok, since Moo has been posted in the lab, I have been looking at the differences between the CD Moo, and the one gotten from combining using a DNA capsule. differences are as follows.

starting stats:
DNA Moo,
lifepowerintskillspddef
10017016012090110


CD Moo,
lifepowintskillspddef
112192158127105124


starting nature for:
dna=-32
CD=-99(worst of the worst)

specials:
dna=anger, fury, and guard
CD=anger, fury

lifespan:
dna=350 weeks
CD=370 weeks

life type:
dna=type 1
CD=type 0(using RR program, so dun ask me)

starting attacks:
dna=bite, tail attack
CD=bite, tail attack, inferno

guts regen (the lower the faster):
dna=19
CD=18

lastly, stat gains:
dna=3 5 5 3 2 3
cd= 4 4 1 2 2 4 (again, using RR's program)

there you have it, Moo from DNA capsule, and Moo from CD.

By John Hawley on Sunday, September 23, 2001 - 08:16 am:

He came from an actual copy of Beck's Mellow Gold. Darthgali found it back in MR1 days for the Magnet it produced and he lucked out and got the only known copy that makes Moo. See "Moo Captured. Ranchers rejoice." above.

By christopher on Sunday, September 23, 2001 - 11:47 am:

With how rare Moo is, I assumed he would have something special about him. He does look cool, and has an extra attack, but Inferno is pretty much useless since he only has a 1 in intelligence. The 2 in Skill, 18 in guts recovery, and his "worst" nature don't make him that special either. I think I'll just get him so I can add the card to my collection.

By Unpleasant Desire on Sunday, September 23, 2001 - 07:42 pm:

Ok from looking at Hengers Rocks analysis, you see that The CD Moo has some slighty better stats than the DNa capsule Moo. Wouldnt it be better to train a monster following its normal baseline gains and then combine it using the dna capsule. That way by combining a monster in a "great" combination you probably would start off with better stats and a bit more techs at your disposal. This would probably cancel out the 20 weeks extra that you get from the CD. Even though the guts regeneration of the CD Moo compared to the DNA Moo is just that bit faster, it may not make that much of a difference in the end. But I'd prefer the DNA Moo because the stat gain is a bit better than the CD one.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, September 23, 2001 - 09:20 pm:

When you combine with the DNA capsule you get the same set of stats & techs each time. I tested this. It does not matter whether the parents are babies, or all 999 with all techs, all DNA monsters have the same starting abilities.

BTW, Moo was not designed to be very hard to find on CD. Tecmo just accidently used a limited pressing of a very common and popular CD. At the time the game came out, Beck Mellow Gold could be found in every new and used CD store in North America.

By hengers rock on Sunday, September 23, 2001 - 11:22 pm:

ummmm, the CD moo has much lower stat gains.

DNA Moo: 3 5 5 3 2 3=21
CD Moo: 4 4 1 2 2 4=17

By Unpleasant Desire on Monday, September 24, 2001 - 06:08 am:

Really Lisa. I would have thought otherwise but I cant say since I havent tried it. I was just going by how some of my other monsters came out after combining using combining items like the Fire Feather or Jokers Mask, I would have thought the same with the Dna capsule.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, September 24, 2001 - 08:29 am:

I made a special save with the dex drive, it's posted at Monster Fenrick's site. (It's in the webring at the bottom of the front page of MRM.) I made 2 DNA capsules of every color, then used 1 of each in combination to make the monsters and left them in the freezer, so the save has one of each frozen plus an extra capsule. To make the monsters, I used up everything I had on the save already frozen. I had mature monsters, middle aged, and when I ran out I shrined the all 25s monol for a few, then started taking them from the market because it's faster. I saved after each combo, and re-did half of them at least twice just to see. Same stats & techs for each capsule every time.

By Nate Railsback on Monday, September 24, 2001 - 02:29 pm:

I can attest to Lisa's statement. No matter who you put together, it's always exactly the same. That irritated me when I went to raise my Gentlemocchi....
